name: boston_housing
task_intro:
**Author**: Harrison, D. and Rubinfeld, D. L.  
**Source**: Boston Housing (1978)  
**Please cite**: Harrison, D. and Rubinfeld, D. L. (1978). Hedonic prices and the demand for clean air. *Journal of Environmental Economics and Management*, 5(1), 81–102.

**Boston Housing Dataset**

Predict the median value of owner-occupied homes (in $1000s) in Boston suburbs from 13 neighborhood-level attributes.

num_feature_intro.CRIM: Per capita crime rate by town.
num_feature_intro.ZN: Proportion of residential land zoned for lots over 25,000 sq.ft.
num_feature_intro.INDUS: Proportion of non-retail business acres per town (industrial proportion).
num_feature_intro.RM: Average number of rooms per dwelling.
num_feature_intro.AGE: Proportion of owner-occupied units built prior to 1940 (%).
num_feature_intro.DIS: Weighted distances to five Boston employment centres.
num_feature_intro.B: 1000(Bk − 0.63)^2 where Bk is the proportion of Black residents by town.
num_feature_intro.LSTAT: Percentage of lower status of the population.

cat_feature_intro.CHAS: Charles River dummy variable (= 1 if tract bounds river; 0 otherwise).
cat_feature_intro.RAD: Index of accessibility to radial highways.

target_description: Median value of owner-occupied homes in $1000s.
